Posts.Content: Hi Carol,,I decided from the beginning that I was going to be my own advocate. I researched until my eyeballs bled.My recon Dr tells all his students when they are in with us, that I was very kind to him by letting him go all through his talk and then telling him what he should do,,and I was right. I had an expander and an implant.That was in 2003. I had capsular contraction and he removed the old implant this year and put in a new kind. It's silicone jelly so it doesn't leak and feels very real. I'm quite satisfied with the whole thing. I couldn't have had the tram anyway,,not enough good tissue, But I'm not sure I would have gone that route anyway. The less surgery, the less chance of infection. Just my opinion.I am amazed at how many intelligent women just sit back and let their doctors make all the decisions without questioning them.The only thing they wouldn't do was a double. I just didn't want the worry,,but that they wouldn't do. Oh well,,can't win them all. Hang in there everyone. Love and Hope,,Bobbie
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy With Raditaion? Yes or No?

Posts.Content: I was in somewhat the same situation. I was told the same thing. Lumpectomy probably followed by radiation /chemo. I researched and decided that a mastectomy was the best road to go. I had immediate reconstruction and never regretted the decision because I didn't need chemo or radiation that way. I was Estrogen positive,all nodes negative but upon further pathology on the breast tissue, minute specs of cancer were found. No one can tell which side is real and I didn't have to pollute my body.It's a matter of the quality of life NOW!
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy With Raditaion? Yes or No?

Posts.Content: I haven't been here in quite a while. I am now 5 years from surgery and off Arimidex. I have no idea what the future holds. At least I can see some kind of future unlike a 34 year old friend of mine Steph. Steph lives in England and is at the mercy of their system. Her cancer has metastasized from breast to bone to liver. While visiting family in France she was given Avastin and was amazed at how well she felt. After returning to England she was appalled to learn that she could not have the drug due to the cost!!! She is appealing as we speak. Please sign this petition in the hopes that she gets the treatment before it's too late. http://www.thepetitionsit.../stephs-fight-for-avastin
Posts.Title: AVASTIN

Posts.Content: Oh Boy, I hate answering these questions but I have decided that since my research and experience has been extensive I should. I have been on Arimidex for 3 1/2 years and almost from the start had joint pain, primarily in my knees. I lived with it for a a couple of years but it kept getting worse. No one, but no one, not doctors, not the drug company could answer a simple question. Is it just pain or is there joint degeneration? On Nov 6th I had a double knee replacement as I had had no cartilage left! Still no one saying anything about aromatase inhibitors contributing to this. I am an active correct weight 64 and when I couldn't dance anymore , I went to an orthopedist. He didn't have a clue! I have finally found that a university in Australia is doing a study. They are taking women who are going on the AI"s and will be doing mri's of joints from the beginning. I will be vindicated yet. The new knees are doing well and I can actually dance again. This is the info Monash University ClinicalTrials.gov Identifier: NCT00111241   Go to clinicaltrials.gov and punch in the numbers.I couldn't believe that that Astra Zeneca wasn't aware of this study,,,they are now!
Posts.Title: arimidex~side effects

Posts.Content: Sorry for the double,,I thought I blew the first one off.
Posts.Title: arimidex~side effects

Posts.Content: This has been my experience being on Arimidex for 3 1/2 years and doing an enormous amount of research. I suffered almost from the start with joint pain, primarily in my knees.I didn't think too much as it was listed as a side effect. As time went on the pain got worse. No one, not the doctors, nor the drug company could answer one simple question. Is it just pain or is there degeneration? Well, on Nov 6th I had a double knee replacement. I had no cartilage left and still no one was willing to even give a thought of Arimidex being a causative agent. There have been studies done that are calling it "menopausal osteoarthritis", because of the lack of estrogen. Monash University ClinicalTrials.gov Identifier: NCT00111241 This is the first actual study that will follow a breast cancer patient from the beginning of treatment with AI's with MRI's. So at least there are those finally looking into it. I don't know what the future holds but I can live with my new knees but I can't live with cancer. I can only hope that it doesn't hit any other joints. I have strewn the landscape with enough of my body parts. You can take a look at the study by going on clinicaltrials.gov and punching in the nct#
Posts.Title: arimidex~side effects

Posts.Content: Sorry for the double,,I thought I blew the first one off.

Posts.Title: arimidex~side effects

Posts.Content: I have been on Arimidex for 3 1/2 years. I had a mastectomy with no chemo or radiation. As I was post menopausal I went right on Armidex. Yes, my hair has thinned considerably but I won't go off the drug for that reason. Too many of my friends had chemo and lost their hair and it seems like a small price to pay for life. They have the most fantastic wigs out now. I just had a double knee replacement due to degeneration of the cartilage. There is a University in Australia doing a study on women on aromatase inhibitors and joint degeneration.I'm sure it is the fact that I am lacking all estrogen. It is the reason for the hair loss, the vaginal dryness and thinning,,and the joint problems. Since estrogen feeds the tumors and no one knows if there is one little bugger still waiting for it's estrogen feeding, I'm sticking with the drug. Certainly it is your decision, but I still have too much living to do to give up. I feel lucky that I didn't need chemo or radiation so I will settle for these problems. It has not stopped me from doing anything I wanted to do. Good Luck!
Posts.Title: please someone answer a ? - if you have had same thing happen or if you know anything that can help me

Posts.Content: I've been on Arimidex for 4 years and last November had a double knee replacement. Of course no one is willing to admit that the degeneration was to to Arimidex, because no one has completed a study. There is now an ongoing study at Monash university in Australia, keeping track of the joints of women who have E+ tumors and are on aromatase inhibitors. My oncologist would like me to complete the 5 years and I will. I would never forgive myself if I gave up now and cancer returned. There is talk of extending the time after 5 years but I will cross that bridge when I come to it. Since the knee replacement, I feel alot better. I'm able to handle the ankle, toes and most of all now, thumb pain! I do take Actonel every week for bone strength, and so far everything is stable. I am waiting for something to give me back my libido!!! Of course being on Effexor doesn't help that situation either!!
Posts.Title: arimedex

Posts.Content: I am a member in very good standing in the joint pain,muscle pain,cramping in fingers,increase in cholesterol,and of course the all important NIGHT SWEATS!!!! club.Oh, forgot weight gain, and I can't even exercise! Anyway, I decided that all this still beats another round of breast cancer. I too use a chillow. I also found a great sleep shirt at www.redhotmommas.com The material wicks away any moisture so if you do sweat, you feel dry almost immediately. Hang in there, we have alot of company. Love and Hope,,Bobbie
Posts.Title: Aromasin and Arimidex

Posts.Content: There is no question in my mind that it was HRT compounded by stress! Of all the breast cancer women I have spoken with, they ALL had  high stress at some point prior to diagnosis. If those who were post menopausal, they had the stress factor and HRT. I also have no genetic factors, and I am the only one in my family ti have joined this club.
Posts.Title: What do you think may have caused your breast cancer?

Posts.Content: I had a lumpectomy first followed by a mastectomy 6 weeks later. I was stage 1,invasive, no nodes, but through a breast MRI they found a suspicious area. They were malignant, but would not have shown up for 3-4 years. I wanted a mastectomy from the get go because I had a gut feeling that I needed it. It also gave me the option of no chemo  or radiation, which I took. I had reconstruction started at the same time as the mastectomy. I really wish I could have done a double. It would save the yearly scare! In this day and age of fantastic reconstruction, if given the choice of mastectomy with no chemo or radiation and a lumpectomy with chemo and radiation,,no question, I would opt for a mastectomy!
Posts.Title: Lumpectamy or Mastectomy? HELP!

Posts.Content: Once again the side effects of Armidex appears. I have been on it for 3 years and my joints still continue to worsen. I went to an Orthopedic surgeon to check my knees and he decided, in his infinite stupidity, that the changes were "age appropriate". Ok, yes I am 63 but to go from having no problems to have osteoarthritis rear it's ugly head and advance so quickly, is beyond my comprehension. It seems that my cry for more information has been heard. Here is a link you all might be interested in. http://www.rheumatology.org/press/2005/estrogenarthritis0905.asp Bobbie
Posts.Title: Side Effects

Posts.Content: Tara, First and foremost, they will do a complete round of testing prior to surgery. They should do a CAT and Bone scan at least. that should answer alot of questions prior to surgery. Hang in there!!
Posts.Title: I need more imfo PLEASE HELP

Posts.Content: I hate to be the bearer of bad tidings but as breast cancer patients you should not use any estrogen at all. I too suffer from vaginal atrophy to the point of skin tearing for no reason. I am on Armidex for 3 1/2 years and both my gynecologist and oncologist suggested the tablets, about 1-2 years ago. I was skeptical because it didn't make sense to me to put estrogen into my body when I'm trying to rid my body of it. But I started to use it because I dont have the degree. It really didn't do much and then I saw this! http://www.medscape.com/viewarticle/522309 I showed it to both doctors and watched their jaw drop. Good thing I'm an info internet junky.
Posts.Title: Vaginal Atrophy Problems

Posts.Content: Sorry it took a while to get back to you but I just had my gallbladder removed. I'm just keeping surgeons busy and leaving body parts all over. Beside the chillow there is nightwear that is great. I'ts lightweight,soft and wicks away the moisture and dries immediately. I found it in a store in New Hope Pa called ted hot mommas. They just got a web site and will ship. the web site is www dot redhotmommas dot com. Don't forget the s on mommas,,,found out it sends you to a xxx site (unless you wanna go there LOL). By drying so quickly one doesn't get chilled from being wet.Let me know how it goes. The sweats are usually due to lack of estrogen or other meds, in her case maybe it is cancer, I'm not that well versed. Bobbie
Posts.Title: Has Anyone Been on Aromasin and Are They Getting Side Effects?

Posts.Content: Yes ,I too have the joint pain and am on Arimidex. My knees belong to some 200 year old woman! My fingers get stiff and cramp. Oh lots of fun. I am writing to AstraZeneca, makers of Arimidex to ask them where they got such low percentages during their trial. I also want to know what they have discovered during ongoing results of tests. I was told by them that they cannot give me up to date info, only medical personnel are able to get these results. I told them to stop adverstising to the public if we cannot have ALL info. I have discovered that I have an increase in cholesterol (another side effect).I will put up with all this if it keeps the cancer from reoccurring(sp).On a lighter note, has anyone experienced the other side effect of breast cancer? You know, the one that makes PINK an attractive color even if you hated it all your life.
Posts.Title: Has Anyone Been on Aromasin and Are They Getting Side Effects?

Posts.Content: Hi Roz: I live in the United States, state of Pennsylvania, town of Chalfont, which is a suburb of Philadelphia. Whew, that took alot of effort. Just to let you know, I am also on a couple of other message boards, one of which is in the UK. We are all sisters in this breast cancer struggle. Everyone I have been in contact with who is on Arimidex has the very same complaint. You can contact AstraZeneca and they will send you alot of stuff about Arimidex. But it's all from the original study. My letter to them is asking for more up to date info as I believe their study was incorrect in the percentage of those with joint pain.I'll Let you know if and when they answer me. By the way, if you suffer from night sweats I found 2 great products. Let me know.You can also email me at --- Message edited by CancerCompass staff: for personal protection, email address removed. Please review CancerCompass Member Guidelines at http://www.cancercompass.com/common/guidelines.html ---. Hang in there, you are not alone
Posts.Title: Has Anyone Been on Aromasin and Are They Getting Side Effects?

Posts.Content: Hi there: The web site in the UK is http://www.breastcancercare.org.uk/Chat Just click on forums and you are good to go. I like the site a lot. They have lots of different topics and even celebrate birthdays. Very informative and fun. Enjoy, Bobbie
Posts.Title: Has Anyone Been on Aromasin and Are They Getting Side Effects?
